skill.name: graphql-schema
skill.description: GraphQL queries, mutations, and code generation patterns. Use when creating GraphQL operations, working with Apollo Client, or generating types.
skill.summary: GraphQL queries, mutations, and code generation patterns. Use when creating GraphQL operations, work...
skill.author: ChrisWiles

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill with no executable code. Contains only markdown guidance for GraphQL development patterns. No file access, network calls, or command execution.

content.value_statement: Writing GraphQL operations manually leads to type errors and maintenance headaches. This skill provides proven patterns for queries, mutations, and Apollo Client integration with automatic type generation.
actual_capabilities: Create .gql files for queries and mutations
Generate TypeScript types from GraphQL operations
Use generated Apollo hooks with proper error handling
Implement optimistic updates for instant UI feedback
limitations: Does not execute GraphQL operations or connect to servers
Requires existing GraphQL schema and codegen setup
Does not write code to your project files
Pattern knowledge only - implementation requires developer action

use_cases.title: Set up GraphQL queries
use_cases.description: Create type-safe GraphQL queries with generated Apollo hooks for React components

use_cases.title: Add mutations with error handling
use_cases.description: Implement mutations with required error handlers, loading states, and cache updates

use_cases.title: Automate type generation
use_cases.description: Generate TypeScript types from .gql files to eliminate manual type maintenance

prompt_templates.title: Create a query
prompt_templates.scenario: Need to fetch data from GraphQL
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to create a GraphQL query for fetching items with pagination. Include the .gql file and how to use the generated hook.

prompt_templates.title: Create a mutation
prompt_templates.scenario: Need to create or update data
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I create a GraphQL mutation for creating a new item? Include error handling and cache update patterns.

prompt_templates.title: Optimistic updates
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to implement optimistic updates for a toggle mutation so the UI updates instantly before the server responds.

prompt_templates.title: Error handling
prompt_templates.prompt: What are the requirements for error handling in GraphQL mutations? Show a complete pattern with logging and user feedback.

output_examples.input: Create a query to fetch users with their roles
output: Create src/queries/GetUsers.gql with the GraphQL query definition
Run npm run gql:typegen to generate the hook
Import useGetUsersQuery from the generated file
Use the hook with variables and handle loading/error states
Apollo handles caching automatically with cache-first policy

best_practices: Never inline gql literals - use separate .gql files for maintainability
Always run codegen after modifying .gql files to update types
Add onError handlers to all mutations with user feedback
Use generated hooks instead of raw Apollo hooks
anti_patterns: Inline gql strings in component files - creates hard-to-maintain code
Skipping error handlers on mutations - users see silent failures
Using raw useMutation instead of generated hooks - loses type safety
Not disabling buttons during mutations - allows duplicate submissions

faq.question: Does this skill connect to my GraphQL server?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides patterns and guidance only. You need to configure Apollo Client separately to connect to your server.

faq.question: What GraphQL clients are supported?
faq.answer: Patterns target Apollo Client. Similar concepts apply to other clients like URQL or Relay with minor API differences.

faq.question: What codegen tools work with these patterns?
faq.answer: Apollo Codegen, GraphQL Code Generator, and similar tools generate types from .gql files. The skill assumes codegen is configured.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill is purely prompt-based with no code execution or file access. It cannot read or transmit any data.

faq.question: Why should I use .gql files instead of inline gql?
faq.answer: Separate .gql files enable code generation, improve IDE support, make refactoring easier, and keep components clean.

faq.question: How is this different from writing raw GraphQL?
faq.answer: This skill promotes type-safe generated hooks that catch errors at compile time. Raw GraphQL requires manual type definitions.
